metadata.subject: [patchmanagement] RE: Errors Installing Win11 KB5032190
metadata.email_text_clean:
Two “brute force” things I try next (rather than beat my head against the wall)
are either upgrade to the next version via ISO (now that 23H2 is out) or do an
in-place upgrade via ISO. The latter installs 22H2 over top of itself and keeps
everything but it behaves like a feature update…removes and reinstalls Windows
out from under the programs and profile. 
---- 
Steve Yates
ITS, Inc.
metadata.evaluated_keywords: ['feature update … remove', 'place upgrade via iso', 'next version via iso', 'latter install 22h2']
metadata.evaluated_noun_chunks: ["Two “brute force” things", "the next version", "a feature update", "the programs"]
metadata.email_text_original:
Two “brute force” things I try next (rather than beat my head against the wall)
are either upgrade to the next version via ISO (now that 23H2 is out) or do an
in-place upgrade via ISO.  The latter installs 22H2 over top of itself and keeps
everything but it behaves like a feature update…removes and reinstalls Windows

Steve Yates
ITS, Inc. 
From: 'Brown, Jeff' via PatchManagement <patchmanagement@googlegroups.com>
Sent: Thursday, November 16, 2023 9:44 PM
To: patchmanagement@googlegroups.com
Subject: [patchmanagement] Errors Installing Win11 KB5032190 
All, 
I am unable to install KB5032190 on my Windows 11 22H2 host.  It fails every
time I try to deploy.  Some of the error messages I am receiving: 
-800F081F 
-80070422 
-“Could not be installed because of error 2148468767” 
Some things I have tried: 
-Renamed SoftwareDistribution folder 
-Ran the Windows Update Troubleshooter 
-sfc /scannow 
-DISM /Online /Cleanup-image /RestoreHealth 
Does anyone have any suggestions on how to proceed? 
--
Link: https://groups.google.com/d/msgid/patchmanagement/SN6PR08MB5517ECE213F00B5A3A9DA62FB7B7A%40SN6PR08MB5517.namprd08.prod.outlook.com
